t: Ezekiel 28
A Prophecy Against the King of Tyre
The*p word of the Lord*s came to me:

“Son of man, say to the ruler of Tyre, ‘This is what the Sovereign Lord*s says: “ ‘In*pn the pride of your heart you*ld say, “I am a god; I*ln sit on the throne of a god in*ld the heart of the seas.” But*ln you are a mere mortal and not a god, though*ld you think you are as wise as a god.
Are*ln you wiser than Daniel? Is*ld no secret hidden from you?
By*ln your wisdom and understanding you*ld have gained wealth for yourself and*ln amassed gold and silver in*ld your treasuries.
By*ln your great skill in trading you*ld have increased your wealth, and*ln because of your wealth your*ld heart has grown proud.
“ ‘Therefore*p this is what the Sovereign Lord*s says: “ ‘Because*pn you think you are wise, as*ld wise as a god,
I*ln am going to bring foreigners against you, the*ld most ruthless of nations; they*ln will draw their swords against your beauty and wisdom and*ld pierce your shining splendor.
They*ln will bring you down to the pit, and*ld you will die a violent death in*ld the heart of the seas.
Will*ln you then say, “I am a god,” in*ld the presence of those who kill you? You*ln will be but a mortal, not a god, in*ld the hands of those who slay you.
You*ln will die the death of the uncircumcised at*ld the hands of foreigners. I*p have spoken, declares the Sovereign Lord*s .’ ”
The*p word of the Lord*s came to me:
“Son of man, take up a lament concerning the king of Tyre and say to him: ‘This is what the Sovereign Lord*s says: “ ‘You*pn were the seal of perfection, full*ld of wisdom and perfect in beauty.

You*ln were in Eden, the*ld garden of God; every*ln precious stone adorned you: carnelian,*ld chrysolite and emerald, topaz,*ld onyx and jasper, lapis*ld lazuli, turquoise and beryl. Your*ln settings and mountings were made of gold; on*ld the day you were created they were prepared.
You*ln were anointed as a guardian cherub, for*ld so I ordained you. You*ln were on the holy mount of God; you*ld walked among the fiery stones.
You*ln were blameless in your ways from*ld the day you were created till*ld wickedness was found in you.

Through*ln your widespread trade you*ld were filled with violence, and*ld you sinned. So*ln I drove you in disgrace from the mount of God, and*ld I expelled you, guardian cherub, from*ld among the fiery stones.
Your*ln heart became proud on*ld account of your beauty, and*ln you corrupted your wisdom because*ld of your splendor. So*ln I threw you to the earth; I*ld made a spectacle of you before kings.

By*ln your many sins and dishonest trade you*ld have desecrated your sanctuaries. So*ln I made a fire come out from you, and*ld it consumed you, and*ln I reduced you to ashes on the ground in*ld the sight of all who were watching.
All*ln the nations who knew you are*ld appalled at you; you*ln have come to a horrible end and*ld will be no more.’ ”
A Prophecy Against Sidon
The*p word of the Lord*s came to me:
“Son of man, set your face against Sidon; prophesy against her

and say: ‘This is what the Sovereign Lord*s says: “ ‘I*pn am against you, Sidon, and*ld among you I will display my glory. You*ln will know that I am the Lord,*s when*ld I inflict punishment on you and*ld within you am proved to be holy.
I*ln will send a plague upon you and*ld make blood flow in your streets. The*ln slain will fall within you, with*ld the sword against you on every side. Then*ln you will know that I am the Lord.*s
“ ‘No*p longer will the people of Israel have malicious neighbors who are painful briers and sharp thorns. Then they will know that I am the Sovereign Lord.*s

“ ‘This*p is what the Sovereign Lord*s says: When I gather the people of Israel from the nations where they have been scattered, I will be proved holy through them in the sight of the nations. Then they will live in their own land, which I gave to my servant Jacob.

They will live there in safety and will build houses and plant vineyards; they will live in safety when I inflict punishment on all their neighbors who maligned them. Then they will know that I am the Lord*s their God.’ ”
